items.sentence: Thanks a lot for all the things you\'ve done for me.
Tom tried to remember where he had put his passport.
Tom wants to know how long you plan to be in Boston.
Tom was only three years old when he came to Boston.
Tom was surprised when Mary asked him out on a date.
Tom would like to become a simultaneous interpreter.
I don\'t think Tom knows what Mary\'s blood type is.
The police think that Tom has killed several people.
The possibility that Tom might do that worried Mary.
We had to shut the window because of the mosquitoes.
I didn\'t understand French when I first moved here.
I didn\'t use to like wine, but now I like it a lot.
I didn\'t want to say anything, but I had no choice.
I don\'t even know how to say "thank you" in French.
Get something to eat and have a good night\'s sleep.
I have eaten at Chuck\'s Diner on several occasions.
I have more than one friend who can\'t speak French.
He gave an explanation about why he had been absent.
He left the house without so much as saying goodbye.
He made up his mind to write in his diary every day.
